prompt: John Goodman: Acclaimed American actor with Emmy and Golden Globe honors. Please write a short biography of John Goodman.
response:
John Goodman, born on June 21, 1960, in Peoria, Illinois, is a renowned American actor known for his distinctive voice and versatility on screen. Growing up in a family of modest means, Goodman developed a passion for acting at a young age, encouraged by his high school drama teacher. He went on to study drama at Knox College in Galesburg, Illinois, where he graduated with a degree in fine arts.

Goodman's early career in the 1980s saw him working as a stage actor, performing in numerous regional productions and Off-Broadway shows. His breakthrough role came in 1989 when he landed the part of Dan Conner on the popular ABC sitcom "Roseanne," earning him a Golden Globe nomination for Best Supporting Actor. The show's massive success and Goodman's lovable, curmudgeonly portrayal of the lovable but loud-mouthed patriarch made him a household name.

Throughout the 1990s, Goodman continued to hone his craft, taking on a range of film roles in projects like "The Flintstones" (1994), "The Big Lebowski" (1998), and "O Brother, Where Art Thou?" (2000). He received widespread critical acclaim for his performance in the 1991 film "Barton Fink," for which he won the National Board of Review Award for Best Supporting Actor.

In the 2000s, Goodman expanded his repertoire, working in television, film, and stage. He had recurring roles on shows like "Monk" and "Community," and lent his voice to animated series like "King of the Hill" and "Monsters, Inc." He also appeared in films like "Tropic Thunder" (2008) and "Inside Llewyn Davis" (2013), which earned him a Critics' Choice Movie Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

In addition to his on-screen work, Goodman has been an active advocate for various social and environmental causes, including supporting organizations that benefit the arts and children's education. He has also been recognized for his philanthropic efforts, receiving the 2019 Humanitarian Award from the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce.

Throughout his illustrious career, John Goodman has earned numerous accolades, including two Emmy Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Despite his many successes, Goodman remains humble and dedicated to his craft, continuing to take on new and exciting projects that showcase his incredible range and talent.

John Goodman is a renowned American actor, born on June 29, 1952, in St. Louis, Missouri. He is best known for his distinctive voice and versatility on stage and screen.

Goodman grew up in a Catholic family and was raised in a suburb of St. Louis. He developed an interest in acting at a young age and began performing in high school plays. After graduating from Missouri State University, Goodman moved to Chicago to pursue a career in theater. He worked with the St. Nicholas Theatre Company and eventually joined the Steppenwolf Theatre Company, where he met many notable actors, including Gary Sinise and Laurie Metcalf.

Goodman's breakthrough role came in 1988 when he played Dan Conner, the lovable but flawed patriarch of the Conner family, in the popular sitcom "Roseanne." His performance earned him multiple Emmy nominations and a Golden Globe Award.

Throughout his career, Goodman has appeared in a wide range of films and television shows, including "The Big Lebowski," "O Brother, Where Art Thou?," "Monk," "Treme," and "The Conners." He has also had a successful career in voice acting, providing voices for characters in animated films and television shows like "Monsters, Inc.," "The Emperor's New Groove," and "American Dad!"

Goodman has received numerous awards and nominations for his performances, including multiple Emmy and Golden Globe nominations. He has also been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and has been named a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.

Despite his success, Goodman has maintained a down-to-earth persona and has been praised for his dedication to his craft and his commitment to his community. He continues to work in film, television, and theater, entertaining audiences with his unique talent and charm.
